heroIntro: Welcome to your family home in San Juan de los Terreros, a thriving coastal community on the Costa Blanca where space to grow meets Mediterranean living. This 3-bedroom villa offers 122m² of thoughtfully designed living space on a generous 258m² plot—perfect for families who want room to expand, entertain, and create lasting memories together. At €391,995, this property represents exceptional value: you're getting premium specification construction at 40% less than comparable homes on Spanish island markets. The villa's layout prioritizes what families need most: separate bedrooms with natural light, practical bathrooms, and flexible living areas. San Juan de los Terreros has become increasingly popular with international families seeking the right balance between affordability, safety, and quality of life. With excellent schools nearby, a thriving expat community, and direct access to some of Spain's most beautiful Blue Flag beaches within 20 minutes, this location offers the lifestyle families dream of without the premium island price tags. Whether you're seeking a primary residence, a holiday retreat with rental potential, or a smart investment, this villa ticks every box.
areaSection: San Juan de los Terreros sits on Almería's stunning southern coast, a quieter alternative to the busier parts of Costa Blanca. This charming pueblo marinero blends authentic Spanish coastal character with modern family-friendly infrastructure. The area benefits from over 300 days of annual sunshine, with temperatures ranging from mild winters to warm summers—ideal for year-round outdoor living. The town developed originally around fishing and agriculture, maintaining that authentic Mediterranean feel while embracing international residents who've discovered its genuine appeal. Geographically, San Juan de los Terreros sits just 40 minutes south of Almería city and enjoys easy access to Mojácar's acclaimed beaches. The microclimate here is noticeably warmer and drier than further north, with sheltered coves and golden-sand beaches defining the coastline. Unlike more developed resort towns, San Juan de los Terreros retains a relaxed, community-oriented atmosphere where locals and internationals coexist naturally.
lifestyleSection: Daily life in San Juan de los Terreros revolves around beaches, community, and genuine Spanish living costs. Your family will enjoy walking to local markets for fresh produce, gathering at beachfront restaurants where English is widely spoken, and participating in an established international community that makes newcomers feel welcome immediately. The expat population here is significant—British, German, Dutch, and Scandinavian families have created a supportive network without the overcrowding of larger resorts. Schools teach in multiple languages, doctors speak English, and restaurant menus cater to international tastes while maintaining authentic Spanish character. Summer brings beach life: swimming in crystal-clear Mediterranean waters, paddleboarding, and evening paseos along the promenade. Year-round, families enjoy hiking accessible trails, visiting nearby Mojácar for dining and culture, or simply enjoying the slower pace and genuine community connections. Cost of living remains remarkably reasonable compared to UK or Northern Europe—groceries, dining out, and services all represent excellent value.
investmentSection: San Juan de los Terreros property market is experiencing healthy +8% year-on-year appreciation, driven by international interest and limited new build inventory. At €3,213/m², this villa sits above the local average (€2,200/m²) due to premium specification—but represents remarkable value compared to Balearic island equivalents at €5,300+/m². Family investors appreciate the dual potential: primary residence with school-appropriate location plus summer rental income. Conservative estimates suggest €800/week rental during peak season (June-September), generating €12,800 annually, with shoulder season bookings extending revenue. The location's growing international school presence and healthcare reputation are driving family migration from more expensive areas. Unlike speculative boom-and-bust markets, San Juan de los Terreros appreciates steadily due to fundamental lifestyle appeal and limited property inventory. Smart buyers recognize this offers both lifestyle security (permanent family home) and financial growth (equity appreciation + rental income).
conclusion: This villa represents the perfect intersection of affordable Mediterranean living and family-practical design. You're not just purchasing 122m² of living space—you're joining an international community where children play safely, schools speak your language, and doctors answer in English. The €391,995 price delivers premium quality at island-market-proof value, with genuine investment appreciation (8% annually) and summer rental income potential. San Juan de los Terreros offers what families actually need: space to grow, schools nearby, safe streets, and beaches within 20 minutes. This property ticks every box. faqs.question: Ile kosztuje ta nieruchomość?
faqs.answer: €391,995 for this 3-bedroom, 2-bathroom villa with 122m² built and 258m² plot. This premium specification home offers exceptional value—40% less expensive than comparable properties on Spanish islands like Mallorca or Ibiza. Payment options include cash, mortgages, or installment plans through Spanish banks offering competitive rates to foreign buyers.

faqs.question: Czy obcokrajowcy mogą kupić nieruchomość w Hiszpanii?
faqs.answer: Yes, absolutely. Foreign nationals have identical property purchase rights as Spanish citizens. You'll need an NIE (Spanish tax identification number) and can purchase through an English-speaking Spanish lawyer. The process takes 6-8 weeks from offer to completion. Many local real estate agents specialize in assisting international buyers through every step.

faqs.question: Czy Costa Blanca to dobre miejsce na zakup nieruchomości?
faqs.answer: Yes, Costa Blanca remains one of Spain's strongest property markets for international buyers. Prices have appreciated steadily (8% year-on-year in San Juan de los Terreros), rental income potential is strong, and the region offers established infrastructure, international communities, and lifestyle appeal. Unlike boom-bust markets, appreciation here is driven by genuine demand from families and retirees.

faqs.question: Jakie są koszty zakupu nieruchomości w Hiszpanii?
faqs.answer: Purchase costs typically total 8-10% of property price: transfer tax (6-11% depending on region), legal fees (€600-1,000), notary fees (€300-500), and registration (€200-300). On €391,995, budget approximately €31,000-39,000 total. Mortgage brokers and lawyers handle most paperwork. Annual property tax (IBI) averages €400-600 for this property size.

faqs.question: Czy mogę uzyskać kredyt hipoteczny w Hiszpanii jako obcokrajowiec?
faqs.answer: Yes, multiple Spanish banks offer mortgages to foreign buyers, typically 60-80% loan-to-value. You'll need proof of income, tax returns, and bank statements. Interest rates are competitive (2.5-4%). BBVA, Santander, and CaixaBank all serve international clients. British mortgage brokers specializing in Spanish properties simplify the process significantly.

faqs.question: Jakie są koszty życia na Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Cost of living in San Juan de los Terreros is remarkably affordable—typically 30-40% less than UK or Northern Europe. Groceries average €200-250/month per person, restaurant meals cost €8-15 for main courses, utilities €80-120/month, and healthcare through private insurance €1,500-2,500 annually. Retired couples manage comfortably on €1,200-1,500/month including housing.

faqs.question: Czy potrzebuję wizy, żeby kupić nieruchomość w Hiszpanii?
faqs.answer: No, property purchase doesn't require a visa. However, if planning extended residency, EU citizens enjoy automatic rights while non-EU nationals need residency visas (obtainable through property purchase if demonstrating sufficient income, typically €1,600+/month). Many British buyers maintain UK residency while owning Spanish property, visiting seasonally or renting it out.

faqs.question: Is this property suitable for families with young children?
faqs.answer: Absolutely. Three separate bedrooms offer privacy for parents and children, the safe neighborhood means children play freely outside, and 258m² plot allows room for toys, gardens, and outdoor activities. Proximity to beaches and parks, international schools, and family-oriented community make this ideal for families with children of any age.

faqs.question: What rental income can I expect during summer?
faqs.answer: Conservative estimates suggest €800/week during peak season (June-September), generating €12,800 for a four-week summer let. Shoulder seasons (May, October) typically command €600/week. Winter months average €400-500/week. Total annual rental potential reaches €15,000-20,000 with professional management, making this viable investment property alongside personal use.

faqs.question: How far is San Juan de los Terreros from UK flights?
faqs.answer: Almería Airport sits 90 minutes driving distance and offers direct flights to London Stansted, London Luton, London Gatwick, and Manchester—typically 2.5-3 hour flights with Ryanair and other carriers. This makes weekend trips to UK feasible while maintaining permanent Spanish home base, ideal for families with UK family connections.
